modules.name: goal-resolver.ts
modules.category: Task integration, Sterling solver, cognitive thought processor
modules.description: * Goal Resolver * * Resolves incoming goal intent to one of three outcomes: * - "continue": existing non-terminal task matches → return its ID * - "already_satisfied": completed task passes verifier → no new task * - "create": no match → create a new task with goalBinding * * Scoring and candidate selection are separated from mutation so matching * correctness can be tested independently (commit...

modules.name: goal-task-sync.ts
modules.category: Task integration, Sterling solver, cognitive thought processor
modules.description: state machine that synchronizes Goal status with Task status changes using a pure reducer; translates task transitions into goal effects and vice versa according to the Goal-Task Binding Protocol; ensures consistent and reliable cross-layer state alignment for the conscious-bot's planning and execution layers

modules.description: Provides a per-key mutex for atomic task execution in the conscious-bot planning layer. Ensures only one non-terminal task per (goalType, goalKey) runs at a time. Central to the goal resolver's lock acquisition and release protocol.

modules.name: periodic-review.ts
modules.category: Task integration, Sterling solver, cognitive thought processor
modules.description: ;Implements periodic goal-task alignment checks. Scans current holds for staleness, goal-task drift, and manual pauses. Generates drift reports and notifies the synchronization mechanism for corrective actions.

modules.name: preemption-budget.ts
modules.category: Task integration, Sterling solver, cognitive thought processor
modules.description: Implements a preemption budget for tasks that are interrupted, allowing them to safely wind down within a 3-step or 5-second limit after a preemption signal. Tracks steps consumed and triggers a pause when the budget expires. Ensures graceful interruption without mid-action state corruption.

modules.name: threat-hold-bridge.ts

Implements the verify_ShelterV0 verifier to determine if a task's target area is sheltered by the environment. Ensures each verifier is time-bounded, idempotent, and side-effect free to maintain reliable goal validation.

modules.name: index.ts

Central to task orchestration and solver delegation in the conscious-bot planning system.

Ensures accurate idle detection for the cognitive workflow and task eligibility tracking in the conscious-bot architecture.

= Provides optimized logging for the Sterling solver, limiting repetitive messages and reducing console output frequency to prevent spam.

 = Ensures critical logs or warnings only appear within allowed intervals, improving bot's clarity and performance.

It centralizes server options such as port, CORS, and MCP server settings. The class ensures a structured and reusable setup for the planning server within the conscious-bot architecture.

requirements: Defines required data types for task planning requests sent from the bot to Sterling.  
SolveInput: Provides the structured envelope for solving tasks, including current state, goals, capabilities, and progress.  
FailureContext: Optionally includes a failure context for repair and retry operations in the solve contract.

Reflexes may veto, pause, or insert * a small fixed sequence, but they do NOT search. If a reflex needs search, * it's a planning capability and belongs in Sterling. * * @pivot 5 — Safety reflexes depend on minimal ExecutionSnapshot, not GOAP-era WorldState. * * @author @darianrosebrook

The wrappers replace unsafe direct calls with typed, structured requests to the gateway, improving safety and clarity. This mechanism is essential for the planning module to correctly integrate task-driven actions in the conscious-bot architecture.

 *

modules.description: Implements A* pathfinding using the place graph structure. Computes optimal routes between places for the navigator. Returns a NavigationPath if a feasible route exists.

modules.name: types.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Provides type definitions for the place graph system used by the conscious-bot's world state and observation queue.

modules.name: observed-resources-index.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Implements a chunk-based spatial index for the observed resources in the world state. Stores block observations with confidence decay and supports efficient nearest-neighbor lookups. Provides event emissions for index updates and chunk activations for the cognitive system.

modules.name: raycast-engine.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Implements efficient visible-only raycasting with occlusion culling and transparent block support. Manages a traversal algorithm to ensure accurate visibility checks in the world state. Provides event emissions for real-time sensing updates and performance monitoring.

modules.name: visible-sensing.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Provides the main coordination of visible sensing for the conscious-bot, orchestrating ray casting and spatial index queries to track visible resources while managing confidence and performance monitoring.

modules.name: index.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: * @conscious-bot/world/sensorimotor - Embodied motor control system * * Exports all sensorimotor-related components for embodied intelligence * with real-time motor control and sensory feedback integration. * * @author @darianrosebrook

modules.name: motor-controller.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: * Motor Controller - Core embodied motor control system * * Translates high-level action intentions into precise, coordinated physical * movements with real-time feedback integration and emergency response. * * @author @darianrosebrook

modules.name: sensorimotor-system.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: * Sensorimotor System - Integrated embodied motor control and feedback * * Main coordination system that integrates motor control, sensory feedback, * and predictive learning for responsive embodied intelligence. * * @author @darianrosebrook

modules.name: sensory-feedback-processor.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Implements real-time sensory data ingestion and adaptive learning from bot's actions.

modules.name: types.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Provides type definitions for the conscious-bot's sensorimotor system, defining motor actions and precise 3D movement schemas for real-time navigation and manipulation in the Minecraft environment. Implements structured enums and coordinate types to model locomotion and object interaction commands. Ensures type safety for all embodied actions used by the planning and execution modules.

modules.name: server.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Provides a persistent storage for the conscious-bot's world state using a Map. Maintains and updates the BotState object for each active agent. Manages and exposes currentWorldState with fields for player, environment, navigation, perception, and sensorimotor data.

modules.name: types.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: Provides the type definitions for the conscious-bot's observation schema, specifically for raycast and DDA sensor outputs. Defines structured types for block IDs, positions, direction, orientation, light levels, and confidence scores in observations.

modules.name: vitest.config.ts
modules.category: World state, observation queue
modules.description: , the vitest config module in the world package configures testing for the conscious-bot by setting up global variables, timeouts, and file resolution for test execution within the monorepo.
